title: How to Make Ma Po Tofu

steps.headline: Set aside some time.
steps.description:
Prep time: 15 minutes
Cook time: 45 minutes
Serves 6

steps.headline: Marinate the ground pork with 1 tablespoon (14.8 ml) soy sauce, 2 teaspoon white cooking wine and 2 minced garlic cloves for half an hour.
Cut the tofu into ½” * ½” cubes.
steps.description: Try to keep the cubes uniform so the tofu will cook evenly.

steps.headline: Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a skillet over medium high heat.
Add the ground pork and sauté until thoroughly cooked.
Mix in the remaining 4 cloves of minced garlic and sauté until the garlic softens.
Stir in 2 tablespoon bean curd sauce and 1 tablespoon soy sauce.
steps.description: Stir for 1 minute or until the mixture begins to bubble at the edges.

steps.headline: If the ground pork is too dry, add 1 tablespoon water to keep the meat moist.
Add the cubed tofu and sauté for 2 minutes.
steps.description: Sauté gently to avoid breaking up the delicate tofu.

steps.headline: Cover and simmer on low heat for 30 minutes.
steps.description: Stir occasionally every 10 minutes. After tofu is added, never use high heat. The tofu will become hard and rubbery.

steps.headline: Dissolve 1 teaspoon cornstarch in 1 tablespoon water.
Pour the cornstarch mixture slowly into the skillet while stirring the tofu.
steps.description: The sauce will thicken as the dish simmers. Do not pour the cornstarch too quickly or globs of cornstarch will form in the dish.

steps.headline: Spoon the contents into a bowl gently, taking care not to break up the tofu cubes.
Garnish with the chopped scallions before serving.

text:
Set aside some time. Prep time: 15 minutes
Cook time: 45 minutes
Serves 6 Marinate the ground pork with 1 tablespoon (14.8 ml) soy sauce, 2 teaspoon white cooking wine and 2 minced garlic cloves for half an hour.  Cut the tofu into ½” * ½” cubes. Try to keep the cubes uniform so the tofu will cook evenly. Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a skillet over medium high heat.  Add the ground pork and sauté until thoroughly cooked.  Mix in the remaining 4 cloves of minced garlic and sauté until the garlic softens.  Stir in 2 tablespoon bean curd sauce and 1 tablespoon soy sauce. Stir for 1 minute or until the mixture begins to bubble at the edges. If the ground pork is too dry, add 1 tablespoon water to keep the meat moist.  Add the cubed tofu and sauté for 2 minutes. Sauté gently to avoid breaking up the delicate tofu. Season with salt to taste.  Cover and simmer on low heat for 30 minutes. Stir occasionally every 10 minutes. After tofu is added, never use high heat. The tofu will become hard and rubbery. Dissolve 1 teaspoon cornstarch in 1 tablespoon water.  Pour the cornstarch mixture slowly into the skillet while stirring the tofu. The sauce will thicken as the dish simmers. Do not pour the cornstarch too quickly or globs of cornstarch will form in the dish. Spoon the contents into a bowl gently, taking care not to break up the tofu cubes.  Garnish with the chopped scallions before serving.  Finished.
